bug.author: henningko
bug.summary: Named Entities ending with s are being lemmatized
bug.description: Named entities ending with s will be treated by the lemmatizer as if they are plurals, e.g. Bernie Sanders turns into bernie sander, ISIS becomes isi, United States becomes united state. It probably also applies to other suffixes. This may be intentional, so maybe adding a flag would be a good solution. Or is there another work around? [Update] Somewhat related: when something like is at the end of a sentence, the named entity becomes . My guess is that this is done to account for acronyms like , <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acronym#Punctuation>but the trend seems to be to eliminate periods from acronyms</denchmark-link> , so punctuation can probably be stripped from the Named Entity altogether (avoiding the inconsistency).

comments.comment: Thanks for the report. Will add tests and fix.
This should be fixed in the next release of the data. There are some details in the associated commit. Thanks again
